case_title: GUL AMIN AND Another vs Haji MUHAMMAD AKRAM
complaint_summary: Haji Muhammad Akram sought permission to withdraw his suit and file a fresh one, citing procedural defects in the original suit.
investigation_summary: The respondents contested the withdrawal application, arguing it was untimely and lacked formal defects. They demanded Rs. 2,500 as compensation for litigation expenses.
judgment_summary: The Peshawar High Court set aside the order of the Additional District Judge allowing withdrawal of the suit with liberty to file a fresh one, citing irregular exercise of jurisdiction and lack of formal defects. The case was remitted for a decision on merits.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition accepted; case remitted to the Additional District Judge, Malakand at Batkhela, for decision on merits.
legal_arguments: Ahmad Din and 3 others v. Town Committee (1972 SCMR 205)
key_issues: Whether procedural defects justify withdrawal of the suit with liberty to file a fresh one.
Whether the Additional District Judge exercised jurisdiction irregularly.

legal_terms.Formal defect: A defect that does not affect the merits of the case but prevents a fair trial.

words_and_phrases.Withdrawal of suit: The act of discontinuing a legal case with or without permission to file a new one.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around procedural defects cited by the plaintiff to withdraw a suit and file a fresh one. The High Court found the lower court's order irregular and remitted the case for a decision on merits.

facts.court_of_origin: Additional District Judge, Malakand at Batkhela
facts.application_request: Withdrawal of suit with liberty to file a fresh suit

respondents_objections.timeliness: Petition for withdrawal was not within time
respondents_objections.compensation_request: Rs. 2,500 as compensation for litigation expenses

lower_court_decision.permission_granted: Allowed withdrawal of suit with liberty to file a fresh suit
lower_court_decision.condition: Payment of Rs. 100 as costs to contesting respondents

issues.formal_defects: No formal defects identified in the suit
grounds_for_withdrawal: Omission of documents or their list

petitioners.contention: No formal defect exists to justify withdrawal
petitioners.legal_reference: Ahmad Din and 3 others v. Town Committee (1972 S.C.M.R. 205)
petitioners.request: Vacate withdrawal order and remit appeal for decision on merits

reasoning: No reasons provided for allowing withdrawal with liberty to sue afresh
Material irregularity in exercise of jurisdiction by lower court
decision.remittance: Case remitted to Additional District Judge, Malakand at Batkhela for decision on merits
